019package org.jgrapes.io.process;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Set;
025import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
026import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
027import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
029import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
031import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
032import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel.DefaultIOSubchannel;
033import org.jgrapes.io.events.Opening;
034import org.jgrapes.io.events.ProcessStarted;
035import org.jgrapes.io.events.StartProcess;
036import org.jgrapes.io.events.StartProcessError;
037import org.jgrapes.io.util.InputStreamPipeline;
038
039/**
040 * Provides a component that runs processes.
041 */
042@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
043public class ProcessManager extends Component {
044
045    private ExecutorService executorService;
046    private Set<ProcessChannel> channels = new HashSet<>();
047
048    /**
049     * Creates a new connector, using itself as component channel. 
050     */
051    public ProcessManager() {
052        this(Channel.SELF);
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Create a new instance using the given channel.
057     * 
058     * @param channel the component's channel 
059     */
060    public ProcessManager(Channel componentChannel) {
061        super(componentChannel);
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Sets an executor service to be used by the event pipelines
066     * that forward data from the process.
067     * 
068     * @param executorService the executorService to set
069     * @return the process manager for easy chaining
070     * @see Manager#newEventPipeline(ExecutorService)
071     */
072    public ProcessManager setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService) {
073        this.executorService = executorService;
074        return this;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Start a new process using the data from the event.
079     *
080     * @param event the event
081     */
082    @Handler
083    public void onStartProcess(StartProcess event) {
084        var pbd = new ProcessBuilder(event.command());
085        if (event.directory() != null) {
086            pbd.directory(event.directory());
087        }
088        if (event.environment() != null) {
089            Map<String, String> env = pbd.environment();
090            for (var entry : event.environment().entrySet()) {
091                if (entry.getValue() == null) {
092                    env.remove(entry.getValue());
093                    continue;
094                }
095                env.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
096            }
097        }
098        try {
099            new ProcessChannel(event, pbd.start());
100        } catch (IOException e) {
101            fire(new StartProcessError(event, "Failed to start process.", e));
102        }
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * The Class ProcessChannel.
107     */
108    public class ProcessChannel extends DefaultIOSubchannel {
109
110        private final StartProcess startEvent;
111        private final Process process;
112        private final EventPipeline downPipeline;
113
114        /**
115         * Instantiates a new process channel.
116         *
117         * @param startEvent the start event
118         * @param process the process
119         */
120        public ProcessChannel(StartProcess startEvent, Process process) {
121            super(channel(), newEventPipeline());
122            this.startEvent = startEvent;
123            this.process = process;
124            synchronized (ProcessManager.this) {
125                channels.add(this);
126            }
127
128            if (executorService == null) {
129                downPipeline = newEventPipeline();
130            } else {
131                downPipeline = newEventPipeline(executorService);
132            }
133
134            // (1) Opening, (2) ProcessStarted(Opened), (3) process I/O
135            downPipeline().fire(Event.onCompletion(new Opening<Void>(),
136                o -> downPipeline().fire(
137                    Event.onCompletion(
138                        new ProcessStarted(startEvent),
139                        s -> startIO()),
140                    this)),
141                this);
142        }
143
144        private void startIO() {
145            new InputStreamPipeline(process.getInputStream(), this)
146                .sendInputEvents();
147            new InputStreamPipeline(process.getErrorStream(), this)
148                .sendInputEvents();
149        }
150
151        /**
152         * Return the event that caused this channel to be created.
153         *
154         * @return the start event
155         */
156        public StartProcess startEvent() {
157            return startEvent;
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Gets the down pipeline.
162         *
163         * @return the downPipeline
164         */
165        public EventPipeline downPipeline() {
166            return downPipeline;
167        }
168    }
169}
